citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility representative stated the IACUC has not prepared any reports of their semiannual reviews nor forwarded
semiannual reports to the Institutional Official. One of the IACUC functions is to assess activities involving animals at the
research facility and report its evaluations to the Institutional Official to ensure they are kept informed of the status of both
the animal use program and the research facilities. The IACUC shall prepare reports of its semiannual reviews and submit
the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility at least once every 6 months.
Correct from this date forward of 31 August 2023 for all future semiannual reviews.

In November of 2022, a student reported to a facility representative that they witnessed another student slap Harold (a 1-
year-old neutered male Staffordshire terrier) across the head during handling activities. The dog was evaluated and found
to have no injuries and an IACUC meeting was called to order to address the matter. The IACUC determined a course of
corrective action for the incident. The use of physical abuse in handling animals can lead to injuries and poor
psychological welfare. Physical abuse shall not be used to train, work or otherwise handle animals.
Correct from this date forward of 31 August 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
